title.value: Биоэнергетический потенциал, прогноз его изменений и использование в качестве критерия диагностики агроторфяных почв разных стадий эволюции
Bioenergy potential, its changes forecast and the usage of it as a criteria for agropeat soils diagnostics on different stages of evolution

journal.title: Land Reclamation : scientific and practical journal

person.name: Semenenko, N.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Land Reclamation

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were determined the peculiar features of transformation of energy properties of peat soils of the Belarusian Polesye region under the influence of long-term anthropogenic load. On the basis of the obtained results there were developed models of forecasting and criteria of diagnostics of energy status of peat soils of different stages of evolution. It is ascertained the bio-energy potential of low-capacity peat soils compounds 22,0 hJ/ha. Under the influence of drainage and continuous agricultural exploitation (50 years) peat soils lose its bio-energy potential and alongside with it the fertility level decreases. In comparison with non-drainage soil bioenergy potential of organogenetic layer in agro-peat soils decrease to 22-35, in agropeat-mineral soils to 41, in mineral residual peat – 52-74 and mineral post-peat – 88 %. The models for bio-energy potential forecasting for peat soils and energy criterion for degro-peat soils diagnostics on different stages of evolution are proposed.
